quoteFirst: At nine o’clock P. M. Feb. 11, a man was sent aloft to see if there was a lighthouse visible. At
quoteLast: he called out, “Light, ho! three points on the port bow.” In five or ten minutes we saw it from the deck. We felt that this part of the voyage was over.
title: Under the mizzen mast: A voyage round the world
author: Adams, Nehemiah, 1806-1878

quoteLast: , when the Bear, with a word of greeting to the guard at the entrance, came out on the floor, it was, to the unaccustomed eyes and ears in the crowded gallery, already a bedlam. Traders and clerks were grouped about that big room, talking in every key of excitement, and little messenger boys, to whom nothing mattered until the bell rang, larked about, pelting one another with handfuls of sample grain, and making a gratuitous addition to the uproar.
title: The banker and the bear
author: Webster, Henry Kitchell, 1875-1932
